column4: hi, does everyone know how to make an optical audio output work with alsa ?
cat /proc/asound/cards
please just ask here; I can't accept dcc chats.
here's the output from cat /proc/asound/cards: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/6803
ok, and what's your sound issue?
optical-out?
does ``aplay -Dplug:iec958 /usr/share/sounds/startup.wav'' produce audible sound?
the jack-output works well, with vlc, Beep, etc. However, I don't know how to make both coaxial and optical outputs work.
jack-output?
and I didn't hear any sound neither with the jack nor the coaxial output
yes, the headphones' output
did you pastebin amixer output?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/6804
you may need to mute 'IEC958 Capture Monitor'
done, but I still don't hear any sound
cat /proc/asound/devices --> pastebin
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/6805
ok, use ``aplay -Dplughw:0,4 /usr/share/sounds/startup.wav''
The probleme is that I want to use my external amplifier through the coaxial or optical output
It gives no sound
ok, then please follow the troubleshooting steps in alsa.opensrc.org -> digital
ok, thank you, I'm going to do so
